description: Creates an Object Lambda Access Point. For more information, see Transforming objects with Object Lambda Access Points in the Amazon S3 User Guide. The following actions are related to CreateAccessPointForObjectLambda:

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID for owner of the specified Object Lambda Access Point.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name you want to assign to this Object Lambda Access Point.

parameters.name: Configuration
parameters.description: Object Lambda Access Point configuration as a JSON document. Standard access point associated with the Object Lambda Access Point. CloudWatchMetricsEnabled (boolean) --- A container for whether the CloudWatch metrics configuration is enabled. AllowedFeatures (list) --- A container for allowed features. Valid inputs are GetObject-Range, GetObject-PartNumber, HeadObject-Range, and HeadObject-PartNumber. (string) --- A container for transformation configurations for an Object Lambda Access Point. (dict) --- A configuration used when creating an Object Lambda Access Point transformation. A container for the action of an Object Lambda Access Point configuration. Valid inputs are GetObject, ListObjects, HeadObject, and ListObjectsV2. (string) --- A container for the content transformation of an Object Lambda Access Point configuration. AwsLambda (dict) --- A container for an Lambda function. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function. FunctionPayload (string) --- Additional JSON that provides supplemental data to the Lambda function used to transform objects.

nested_params.name: SupportingAccessPoint
nested_params.description: Standard access point associated with the Object Lambda Access Point.

nested_params.name: CloudWatchMetricsEnabled
nested_params.description: A container for whether the CloudWatch metrics configuration is enabled.

nested_params.name: AllowedFeatures
nested_params.description: A container for allowed features. Valid inputs are GetObject-Range, GetObject-PartNumber, HeadObject-Range, and HeadObject-PartNumber.

nested_params.name: TransformationConfigurations
nested_params.description: A container for transformation configurations for an Object Lambda Access Point.

nested_params.name: Actions
nested_params.description: A container for the action of an Object Lambda Access Point configuration. Valid inputs are GetObject, ListObjects, HeadObject, and ListObjectsV2.

nested_params.name: ContentTransformation
nested_params.description: A container for the content transformation of an Object Lambda Access Point configuration.

nested_params.name: AwsLambda
nested_params.description: A container for an Lambda function.

nested_params.name: FunctionArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function.

nested_params.name: FunctionPayload
nested_params.description: Additional JSON that provides supplemental data to the Lambda function used to transform objects.

nested_items.name: ObjectLambdaAccessPointArn
nested_items.description: Specifies the ARN for the Object Lambda Access Point.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The alias value of the Object Lambda Access Point.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Object Lambda Access Point alias. If the status is PROVISIONING, the Object Lambda Access Point is provisioning the alias and the alias is not ready for use yet. If the status is READY, the Object Lambda Access Point alias is successfully provisioned and ready for use.
